column2: officially the Municipality of Aliaga (Tagalog: Bayan ng Aliaga)
column3: is a 2nd class municipality in the province of Nueva Ecija

column2: Aliaga became a town on February 8
column4: and named after the Spanish hometown of its first gobernadorcillo
column5: Aniceto Pere. It once included the present-day municipalities of Zaragoza

column1: It has a comparatively cool and healthful climate
column2: and is situated about midway between the Pampanga Grande and the Pampanga Chico rivers
column3: in a large and fertile valley. Historically
column4: the principal products were mostly agricultural such as rice

column1: Aliaga is politically subdivided into 26 barangays.
Tagalog and Ilocano are the most important and the major languages of the municipality.

The Taong Putik Festival is an annual festival held in the municipality on the feast day of Saint John the Baptist every 24th day of June.  The religious festival is celebrated by the locals and devotees to pay homage to Saint John the Baptist by wearing costumes patterned from his attire. Devotees soak themselves in mud and cover their body with dried banana leaves and visit houses or ask people for alms in the form of candles or money to buy candles which is them offered to Saint John the Baptist.
